section.title: Terminology and notation

li.p: a pair of square matrices A and B for which there exists an invertible matrix P satisfying B=\inv{P}AP

note.p: Similarity is symmetric: if B is similar to A with B = \inv{P}AP, then A is similar to B by A = \inv{Q}BQ, for Q = \inv{P}.

li.p: an invertible matrix P that realizes a similarity relationship B=\inv{P}AP for similar matrices A and B
a square matrix that is similar to a diagonal matrix

section.p:
The next two definitions apply to an eigenvalue of a square matrix.
algebraic multiplicity
the number of times the eigenvalue is repeated as a root of the characteristic polynomial of the matrix
geometric multiplicity
the dimension of the corresponding eigenspace
